memberdef.definition: typedef void(* CGAL::Failure_function)(const char *type, const char *expression, const char *file, int line, const char *explanation)

memberdef.name: Failure_function

memberdef.argsstring: (ForwardIterator first, ForwardIterator last, CompareMin comp_min, CompareMax comp_max)
memberdef.name: min_max_element

briefdescription.para: checks at compile time if its argument is a circulator.
checks at compile time if its argument is an iterator.
checks at compile time if its argument is a circulator or iterator.
The distance of a circulator c to a circulator d is the number of elements in the range [c, d).

detaileddescription.para: It is defined to be zero for a circulator on an empty sequence and it returns the size of the data structure when applied to a range of the form [c, c).

briefdescription.para: The size of a circulator is the size of the data structure it refers to.

detaileddescription.para: It is zero for a circulator on an empty sequence. The size can be computed in linear time for forward and bidirectional circulators, and in constant time for random access circulators using the minimal circulator. The function circulator_size(c) returns the circulator size. It uses the c.min_circulator() function if c is a random access circulator.

briefdescription.para: is true if the range [i, j) is empty, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: In order to write algorithms that work with iterator ranges as well as with circulator ranges we have to consider the difference of representing an empty range. For iterators this is the range [i,i), while for circulators it would be c == NULL, the empty sequence test. The function is_empty_range() provides the necessary generic test which accepts an iterator range or a circulator range and says whether the range is empty or not.

simplesect.para: IC is either a circulator or an iterator type. The range [i, j) is valid.

detaileddescription.para: The following function process_all() accepts a range [i, j) of an iterator or circulator IC and processes each element in this range:

briefdescription.para: The following function returns the distance between either two iterators or two circulators.
This function matches for type I if the iterator category of I belongs to an iterator.
This functiona matches for type C if the iterator category of C belongs to a circulator.
